title: WEATHER FORECAST FOR 11 JANUARY 2026 Issued at 2.00 p.m. on 10 January 2026 The depression over the southwest Bay of Bengal was located about 20 km East of Mullaitivu at 11:30 a.m. on 10 January 2026. It is likely to cross the Mullaitivu coast around today evening. It is likely to weaken to a low-pressure area by tomorrow. Accordingly, it can be expected that the influence of this system on the island's weather will gradually reduce by tomorrow. Showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Northern, North-central, Uva, and Eastern provinces. Several spells of showers may occur in the North-western and Central provinces. Showers or thundershowers may occur at a several places elsewhere during evening or night. Fairly strong winds about (30-40) kmph can be expected at times over Northern, North-western provinces and in Matale, Trincomalee and Nuwara-Eliya districts. The general public is kindly requested to take adequate precautions to minimize damages caused by temporary localized strong winds and lightning during thundershowers.
